noun.description: (in the grammar of Latin, Greek, and other languages) the variation of the form of a noun, pronoun, or adjective, by which its grammatical case, number, and gender are identified.
A condition of decline or moral deterioration.
examples: the declension of the new generation

origin: Late Middle English declinson, from Old French declinaison, from decliner to decline. The change in the ending was probably due to association with words such as ascension.
